p: Traditional micronization and encapsulation techniques do not usually allow a high level of control of particle size distribution. Moreover, they often use toxic and polluting solvents and need high temperature, unsuitable for thermolabile compounds. For example, spry drying requires high temperatures that may cause oil deterioration [ 84]. Another important factor is that residual oil adherent to the capsule surface can easily oxidize altering the organoleptic properties of the supplement.
